Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Romantic Tensions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town and the central characters, Nan and Cal, amidst the backdrop of the town's impending demolition and their complex romantic relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Initial Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the stage with the introduction of Ghost Town and the initial contrasting viewpoints on romance and practicality between a woman and a man in a saloon.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town's Fate and Emotional Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the imminent demolition of Ghost Town for an airport and the woman's emotional reaction, leading to a deeper conversation with Cal about her feelings and the town's significance.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Exit and Ghost Town Ride
Ghost Town's Past and Airport Future
Emotional Argument about Ghost Town's Demolition

sub_scenes.title: Family Conflict and Seeking Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces family dynamics and conflict, particularly between Nan and her father, related to business and the changing times, and Nan's subsequent emotional distress.

sub_scenes.title: Maternal Comfort and Seeking Clarity with Cal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan receiving comfort and advice from her mother and maid, leading to her decision to seek clarity from Cal about their relationship and future.

narrative_arcs.title: Maid's Pragmatic View on Love and Action

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Resolution and Impending Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sees Nan and Cal's relationship reach a turning point with a confession and reconciliation, immediately followed by the looming threat of a severe snowstorm.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Reconciliation and Understanding
Mr. Wills and Son Assess the Snowstorm's Severity
Grave Concerns about Livestock and Fodder
Confirmation of the Weather's Unprecedented Danger
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst Hardship
Cal's Ominous Reflection on Impending Starvation and Future Uncertainty
Nan's Doubt and Cal's Reassurance in the Face of Crisis
Nan's Mother's Plea for Rest and Hope Amidst Overwhelming Odds
Cal's Restless Night and the Unrelenting Snow
Despair and Weariness in the Face of Endless Winter
Sound of an Airplane and a Glimmer of Hope
Excitement and Realization of Fodder Drop
Conversation on Romance Amidst Crisis and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova and Jeff's Path
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting and characters, focusing on Chane Benson's arrival in Cowtown, Jeff's admiration for him, and the escalating tensions leading to a showdown and moral choices.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Reactions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a fight scene in Cowtown and shows the varied reactions of the townspeople to his actions and persona.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and a Town Scene
Reactions and Judgments of Bystanders on Chane Benson's Actions
Further Reactions and Cynical Commentary on Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Mother's Concerns and Moral Contrast
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Jeff's mother's worries about his fascination with violence and contrasts Chane Benson with Clyde Surrett as moral examples.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Flashback and Concerns About Jeff
Macho Banter and Violent Undertones between Clyde and Chane

sub_scenes.title: Sally and Clyde's Intervention for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Sally and Clyde discussing and deciding to help Jeff, who seems to be heading down a dangerous path influenced by Chane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Affectionate Agreement and Future Vision
Narrator's Observation of Jeff's Absence and Town Ride
Sally Seeks Advice from Mr. Benson
Mr. Benson's Advice on Violence and Youth

sub_scenes.title: Newspaper Article and Escalating Tensions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene centers around a controversial newspaper article and the reactions of Sally and Clyde, revealing Clyde's role as the editor and setting up further conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Outrage Over the Article and Initial Talk with Benson
Sally Confronts Clyde, the Editor, About the Article
Clyde's Dismissive Reaction and Sally's Criticism
Sally Seeks Benson's Guidance in Juniper

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Plan and Dinner with Chane
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene outlines Benson's plan to expose a 'murderer' and involves Jeff and Sally inviting Chane Benson to dinner, leading to complex interpersonal dynamics.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Reaction to the Article and Speculation on Clyde's Response
Considering Dinner with Chane and Reflecting on His Character

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's Aftermath and Town Showdown
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the tense aftermath of the dinner with Chane, including misunderstandings, physical confrontation, and culminating in a showdown in town.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Dinner Moonlight Conversation and Rising Tension
Immediate Aftermath and Explanations Following the Forced Kiss
Realization of Danger to Clyde and Urgent Need to Go to Town
Jeff's Determined Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation in Town and Jeff's Intervention
Escalating Tensions and a Challenge to a Fistfight
Anxious Wait in the Clarion Office
Recounting the Night's Events and Newspaper Priority
Praise for Jeff and Clyde's Character and Family Values

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Conflicts and Betsy's Choice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to ranch-based conflicts, introducing Betsy as a central figure dealing with range wars, a new ranch hand, and ultimately making pivotal decisions about love and duty.

sub_scenes.title: New Boss and Ranch Under Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Steve Daley as the new boss and reveals the growing problems on the ranch, hinting at a potential range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the New Boss, Steve Daley
Settling Steve In and Past Doubts
Ranch Troubles and Range War Fear
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Betsy's Romantic Awakening
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy and Steve's trip to town, escalating into a confrontation with Fred Bridges and Betsy's growing romantic feelings for Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Range War and Betsy's Determination
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases the escalating range war tensions, Betsy's firm stance, and Steve's defense against accusations, leading to Betsy's decision to arm herself.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Hank and Steve's Defense
Justification for Arms and Recall of Ambush
Betsy's Narration of Pursuit and Arrival at Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reaches a climax at Devil's Pass with a confrontation and near-death experience for Steve, followed by a romantic reconciliation and deeper commitment between Betsy and Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Capture at Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Cowtown Casanova - Carrie's Dilemma and Fred's Deception
sub_scenes.description: Returning to the 'Cowtown Casanova' storyline, this sub-scene focuses on Carrie's complex relationships, Fred's manipulative nature, and the revelation of his deception regarding the Carlton contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Behavior and Ranch Concerns
Discussion of Fred and Differing Opinions
Agreement to Avoid Conflict and Carrie's Reflection
Encounter with Fred Gordon and Ominous Question
Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon's Conversation about Dave's Feelings
Accusations and Assertions in Carlton's Office
Reflecting on Past Pride and Present Hurt with Fred
Unexpected Encounter and Cold Dismissal in Town
Concern and Defiance in the Buckboard
Father and Dave's Clarification & Carlton's Interjection
Dave's Confession and Carrie's Ride to Fred

sub_scenes.title: Cowtown Casanova - Chris and Dirk's Escape and Final Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This final sub-scene concludes the 'Cowtown Casanova' storyline, focusing on Chris and Dirk's escape, the ensuing pursuit and gunfight, and the ultimate romantic resolution for Chris.

narrative_arcs.title: Late Night Visitor and Urgent Plea
Worried Kin and a Father's Decision
Plea for Mercy and a Change of Plans
Duty vs. Love and a Hint of Escape
Decision to Act and Arming Dirk
